creator: ArkansasDiscoveryNetwork
title: Makey Makey Water Piano
materials_required: 9 x alligator clips (more may be necessary depending on length)
Piano program designed for Makey Makey
description: This project describes how to create a water piano using a Makey Makey, where separate water buckets act as keys, triggering notes in a Scratch-made piano program.
steps: Run conductive tape strips from the inside bottom of each bucket to a fold-over tab above the bucket. The tabs will be alligator clipped to individual keys on the Makey Makey. Ensure the tabs are at the top edge of the bucket to avoid contact with water spillage.

Create a grounding strip by running conductive tape along the front of the buckets with a fold-over tab, or use an aluminum pie pan as an interactive ground.  Attach the grounding strip or pie pan to "Earth" on the Makey Makey.
Fill each bucket about 2/3 full with water and arrange them in a line.
Using the piano program as a guide, use alligator clips to connect each color-coded bucket to the Makey Makey, ensuring the splash shield protects the Makey Makey from water.
Connect the Makey Makey to the laptop via USB and launch the piano program.
Experiment and play music by touching the water in the buckets while grounded.

creator: ArkansasDiscoveryNetwork
title: Makey Makey Water Piano
materials_required: 9 x alligator clips (more may be necessary depending on length)
Piano program designed for Makey Makey
description: This project demonstrates how to create a water piano using a Makey Makey, Scratch, and water-filled buckets. Each bucket acts as a key, triggering a different note in the Scratch piano program when touched, creating an interactive musical experience.
steps: Run conductive tape strips from the inside bottom of each bucket to a fold-over tab above the bucket.
Run a conductive tape strip the length of the area in front of the water bucket piano with a fold-over tab at one end to act as a ground.
Fill each bucket about 2/3 full with water and lay them out inline.
Using the piano program as a guide, use alligator clips to wire each color-coded bucket to the Makey Makey. Ensure the splash shield protects the Makey Makey from getting wet.
Hook the Makey Makey up to the laptop using included USB cable and launch the piano program.
Experiment and make music by touching the water in the buckets to complete the circuit and trigger the corresponding piano notes.
